article_title: President Obama Rates Obamacare on Scale of 1 to 10
article_text:
During a lightning round with ABC medical correspondent Richard Besser, Wednesday morning President Barack Obama gave his signature health care law an eight out of 10, or what kids presenting their report card to their parents call a “B”.

“The reason I don’t put it as a 10 is you can always improve something,” Obama said during an interview on public health on Good Morning America.

What would that something be? Sorry, no follow up questions in the lightning round. Watch below, via ABC:

Please enable Javascript to watch.

[Image via ABC/screengrab]

——
